subtopics.title: Addition of Whole Numbers
subtopics.content:
1. Addition of Whole Numbers

To combine or put together numbers.

Example: 35 + 28 = 63.

Properties of Addition:

  • Closure: Sum of two whole numbers is always a whole number.
  • Commutative: a + b = b + a.
  • Associative: (a + b) + c = a + (b + c).
  • Identity: a + 0 = a.

questions.question: Which of these is a whole number?
questions.explanation: Whole numbers start from 0 and include all natural numbers: {0, 1, 2, 3, â€¦}. They do not include negative numbers or decimals.

questions.question: Which property is shown by 23 + 0 = 23?
questions.explanation: The identity property of addition states that adding zero to any number gives the same number. Here, 23 + 0 = 23.
